titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. J. H. McCuan, Indictment
CWG3120

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Apprehension of Fugitives from Justice Papers, 1859-1862

body.p:
Graves Circuit Court
Commonwealth of Kentucky
against } Indictment
J H. McCuan
The Grand Jury of Graves County in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, accuse J. H. McCuan of the crime of Murder committed as followeth viz:

The said J H McCuan on the 14th day of June 1859 in the County aforesaid did feloniously and with malice aforethought kill and Murder John Wiggins by stabbing him with a knife or some other edged weapon against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

A. P. Thompson
Atto for the Comlth of Kentucky first Judicial Distrist

Information given by
J S Roach
J. D. Boozer & D. G. Heart

marked on back
A true Copy bill
Wm. C. Robbins foreman

A true Copy
Ervin Anderson C. G. C. C
